meanings.definition: An image produced on a sensitive plate or film by X-rays.
meanings.sent1: The radiograph showed a clear picture of the broken bone.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the radiograph to diagnose the patient's condition.
meanings.sent3: The radiograph looked like a mysterious puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a radiograph, revealing hidden thoughts and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The radiograph captured the intricate details of the internal organs.

meanings.definition: To produce an image of (an internal structure) by X-rays.
meanings.sent1: The technician will radiograph your teeth to check for cavities.
meanings.sent2: They radiograph the chest to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: I radiograph my messy room to see where everything is hiding.
meanings.sent4: His words radiograph the truth, exposing the lies beneath.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush radiographs the beauty of nature onto the canvas.
